avalancheActivity.comment:
The large wind slabs of the last few days are to be evaluated with care and prudence in particular in steep terrain. These can be released, even by a single winter sport participant. This applies especially in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain in particular at intermediate and high altitudes.
Avalanches can in some cases penetrate deep layers and reach quite a large size.
The avalanche prone locations are barely recognisable because of the poor visibility. The current avalanche situation calls for careful route selection.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Fresh wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment: Over a wide area 25 to 50 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell in the last four days above approximately 1500 m. As a consequence of the strong wind the wind slabs have increased in size. Faceted weak layers exist deeper in the old snowpack in particular on shady slopes. In the last few days on steep slopes medium-sized and large avalanches were observed.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The sometimes large wind slabs of the last few days must be evaluated with care and prudence. These can in some places be released, even by a single winter sport participant. This applies especially in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain in particular at intermediate and high altitudes, and on steep slopes above approximately 2200 m.
Avalanches can be released in deep layers and reach quite a large size. Whumpfing sounds and the formation of shooting cracks when stepping on the snowpack serve as an alarm sign. Some snow will fall. The avalanche prone locations are barely recognisable because of the poor visibility. Backcountry touring calls for careful route selection.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs and weakly bonded old snow require caution.

snowpackStructure.comment: Over a wide area 20 to 30 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell in the last three days above approximately 1500 m. As a consequence of the strong wind the wind slabs have increased in size. Faceted weak layers exist deeper in the old snowpack in particular on shady slopes. Since Sunday on steep shady slopes medium-sized to large avalanches were released.

avalancheActivity.comment: As a consequence of new snow and a moderate to strong wind, wind slabs formed in the last few days in particular above the tree line. Wind slabs can in some places be released by small loads, in particular at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack. They represent the main danger. Caution is to be exercised in pass areas in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain, in particular on steep slopes.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Fresh wind slabs at intermediate and high altitudes.

snowpackStructure.comment: 20 to 40 cm of snow fell in the last four days above approximately 1800 m. As a consequence of new snow and a moderate to strong wind, wind slabs formed.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Above approximately 900 m snow will fall from early morning. The sometimes moderate wind will transport the new snow. As the day progresses as a consequence of new snow and strong wind there will be an increase in the danger of dry avalanches within the current danger level. The wind slabs can be released in isolated cases in particular on steep shady slopes above approximately 2400 m. The avalanche prone locations are sometimes covered with new snow and are barely recognisable because of the poor visibility.
Be careful, many rocks hidden.
avalancheActivity.highlights: As a consequence of new snow and wind the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent in the afternoon.

snowpackStructure.comment: Up to 2100 m and above rain fell on Monday. In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust. The wind slabs are to be found in particular in gullies and bowls and in the high Alpine regions.

tendency.highlights: As a consequence of new snow and wind the prevalence and size of the avalanche prone locations will increase. Gradual increase in avalanche danger.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The sometimes strong wind has transported the new snow. The fresh snow of the last four days and in particular the wind slabs to be found above the tree line represent the main danger. The wind slabs are mostly small but to be assessed with care and prudence, especially on very steep slopes adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls.
At low altitude only a little snow is lying. Be careful, many rocks hidden by fresh snow.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The sometimes strong wind has transported the new snow. Be careful, many rocks hidden by fresh snow.

snowpackStructure.comment:
20 to 30 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell in the last four days above approximately 1800 m. As a consequence of new snow and a moderate to strong wind, wind slabs formed.
Above the tree line snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind. In all altitude zones only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.
